intro: Clidemia capitellata var. levelii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in coastal and lowland forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat. However, it is considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native range.
